definition: Superfluous; exceeding what is necessary.

definition: A short poetical composition proper to be set to music or sung; a lyric poem; esp., now, a poem characterized by sustained noble sentiment and appropriate dignity of style.

example: Child modelled his work on Svend Grundtvig's Danmarks gamle Folkeviser, classifying and numbering the ballads and noting different versions, which were placed side by side to aid comparison.
example_meaning: Cấu trúc cuốn sách của Child dựa trên "Danmarks gamle Folkeviser" ( Dân ca Đan Mạch xưa cũ) của Svend Grundtvig, phân loại và đánh số các bản ballad cũng như quan tâm đến các dị bản - được xếp cạnh nhau để dễ dàng cho việc so sánh.
definition: A long song or poem that tells a story.

example: Taira no Kiyomori is the main character in the Kamakura period epic , the Tale of Heike.
example_meaning: Taira no Kiyomori cũng là nhân vật chính trong thiên anh hùng ca thời kỳ Kamakura, Truyện kể Heike.
definition: An extended narrative poem in elevated or dignified language, celebrating the feats of a deity or demigod (heroic epic) or other legendary or traditional hero.

example: George Gershwin composes Rhapsody In Blue.
example_meaning: Geogre Gershwin sáng tác bản Rhapsody in Blue.
definition: An ancient Greek epic poem (or part of one) suitable for uninterrupted recitation.

example: As a consequence, the ARM, 68k, 64-bit x86 and PPC ports of Haiku use only the GCC version 7 compiler.
example_meaning: Như một hệ quả, các kiến trúc ARM, 68k, 64-bit x86 và cổng PPC của Haiku chỉ dùng phiên bản GCC 4.
definition: A Japanese poem of a specific form, consisting of three lines, the first and last consisting of five morae, and the second consisting of seven morae, usually with an emphasis on the season or a naturalistic theme.

example: After the war, he began holding tanka writing parties that included several noted poets such as Yosano Akiko.

definition: a form of Japanese verse in five lines of 5,7,5,7,7 syllables

example: Fears also have plots . They have beginnings and middles and ends.

example: The story may have little plot progress and often has no exposition , conflict, or dénouement, but rather has an open ending.

definition: The action of exposing something to something, such as skin to the sunlight.

example: As the setting for the demonstrations, show a family having a practice session.
